Authors:
Yit Kheng Goh, Teik-Khiang Goh, Nurul Fadhilah Marzuki, Hun
Jiat Tung, You Keng Goh, Kah Joo Goh
Title:
Scytalidium parasiticum sp. nov., on Ganoderma boninense from
oil palm in Malaysia
Abstract:
A mycoparasite, Scytalidium parasiticum (Ascomycetes) sp.
nov., isolated from the basidiomata of Ganoderma boninense causing basal
stem rot (BSR) of oil palm in Johor, Malaysia, is described and
illustrated. It is distinct from other Scytalidium species in having
smaller asci and ascospores (teleomorphic stage), longer arthroconidia
(anamorphic stage), hyaline to yellowish chlamydospores, and producing a
fluorescent pigment. The phylogenetic position of S. parasiticum was
determined by sequence analyses of the internal transcribed spacers and
the small-subunit ribosomal RNA gene regions. A key to identify
Scytalidium species with teleomorphic stage is provided.
